verse: आदौ राधां समुच्चार्य पश्चात् कृष्णं परात्परम्। स एव पण्डितो  योगी  गोलोकं याति लीलया॥ (ब्र.वै.पु.)

terms.योगी (Yogee): a yogi; one who practices yoga
terms.गोलोकं (Golokam): Goloka; a divine abode of Lord Krishna

meaning: Meaning: In the beginning, by praising Radha, and afterwards, by glorifying Krishna who is beyond everything, that very pandita (learned person) who is a yogi, indeed, attains the divine abode of Goloka through divine play.Note: This verse is from the Brahma Vaivarta Purana, a Hindu scripture, and it describes the path to liberation through devotion and the divine play of Radha and Krishna.
